description: The Southwestern state was central to the development of nuclear weapons. When the testing ground for the first detonation recently reopened for visitors, a writer decided to confront that difficult history.
dc:creator: Nina Burleigh
media:credit: John Burcham for The New York Times
media:description: The undulating dunes of White Sands National Park, in Alamogordo, N.M., are surrounded by the White Sands Missile Range, where the first atomic bomb was test detonated in 1945.
